required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Product Evaluation for the Effectiveness of the ClearGuard® HD End Cap
clinical_study.official_title: Product Evaluation for the Effectiveness of the ClearGuard® HD End Cap

brief_summary.textblock: To assess blood stream infections in participants using two FDA-cleared devices: ClearGuard HD end caps compared to the Tego® connector with the CurosTM for Tego disinfecting port protector.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, cluster-randomized, open-label, post market, comparative effectiveness evaluation with facilities participating for up to 13 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive Blood Cultures (PBC's) Per 1,000 Central Venous Catheter (CVC)-Days
primary_outcome.description: This was calculated by dividing the cumulative number of PBCs by cumulative time at-risk as follows. The National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) Center for Disease Control (CDC) 21-day outpatient hemodialysis patient rule is as follows: A PBC is considered a new event and counted only if it occurred 21 days or more after a previously reported PBC in the same patient; new PBC events are based on blood cultures drawn as an outpatient or within one calendar day after a hospital admission. Following a PBC additional same-type events were counted beginning 21 days following the initial event; the CVC-days were counted during this period. The CVC-days were calculated by summing the number of days each patient was at-risk of accruing a PBC. This analysis included all subjects that participated in the study that were not otherwise censored to more accurately count CVC-days.

arm_group.description: Tego® connector with the CurosTM for Tego disinfecting port protector

intervention.description: The ClearGuard HD end cap elutes chlorhexidine acetate into the hemodialysis hub

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients dialyzing with a central venous catheter
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to chlorhexidine

overall_official.affiliation: DaVita Clinical Research / DaVita HealthCare Partners

results_reference.citation: Brunelli SM, Van Wyck DB, Njord L, Ziebol RJ, Lynch LE, Killion DP. Cluster-Randomized Trial of Devices to Prevent Catheter-Related Bloodstream Infection. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2018 Apr;29(4):1336-1343. doi: 10.1681/ASN.2017080870. Epub 2018 Feb 22.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Baseline characteristic data were not collected for the participants in the “Intervention” Period. Baseline data were collected for the “Run-In” Period with the a priori intent of showing that baseline characteristics were similar in both arms. 9 patients were excluded due to heparin allergies prior to enrollment during the "Intervention" period.

group.title: Treatment
group.description: ClearGuard HD End Cap ClearGuard HD End Cap: The ClearGuard HD end cap elutes chlorhexidine acetate into the hemodialysis hub

group.title: Control
group.description: Tego® connector with the CurosTM for Tego disinfecting port protector

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Didn't use CVC for at least 21 days
Didn't use CVC for at least 21 day

baseline.population: Baseline characteristic data were not collected for the participants in the “Intervention” Period. Baseline data were collected during the “Run-In” Period with the a priori intent of demonstrating that baseline characteristics are generally balanced for the participants coming in for treatment.”

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

The National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) Center for Disease Control (CDC) 21-day outpatient hemodialysis patient rule is as follows: A PBC is considered a new event and counted only if it occurred 21 days or more after a previously reported PBC in the same patient; new PBC events are based on blood cultures drawn as an outpatient or within one calendar day after a hospital admission. Following a PBC additional same-type events were counted beginning 21 days following the initial event; the CVC-days were counted during this period. measure.title: Positive Blood Cultures (PBC's) Per 1,000 Central Venous Catheter (CVC)-Days
measure.description: This was calculated by dividing the cumulative number of PBCs by cumulative time at-risk as follows. The National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) Center for Disease Control (CDC) 21-day outpatient hemodialysis patient rule is as follows: A PBC is considered a new event and counted only if it occurred 21 days or more after a previously reported PBC in the same patient; new PBC events are based on blood cultures drawn as an outpatient or within one calendar day after a hospital admission. Following a PBC additional same-type events were counted beginning 21 days following the initial event; the CVC-days were counted during this period. The CVC-days were calculated by summing the number of days each patient was at-risk of accruing a PBC. This analysis included all subjects that participated in the study that were not otherwise censored to more accurately count CVC-days.

reported_events.desc: The run-in data was used to determine pre-study demographics and PBC rate. No adverse event analysis was performed for this period since these patients were not enrolled in the study. This was a pragmatic post market study. There was an informed consent waiver and there were no study case report forms (CRF's). Treatment arm adverse events were monitored during the 13-month intervention period using the FDA Manufacturer and User Facility Device Experience (MAUDE) database.

group.title: Treatment
group.description: ClearGuard HD End Cap ClearGuard HD End Cap: The ClearGuard HD end cap elutes chlorhexidine acetate into the hemodialysis hub

group.title: Control
group.description: Tego® connector with the CurosTM for Tego disinfecting port protector

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was a pragmatic post market study. There was an informed consent waiver and no CRF's. Treatment arm adverse events during the 13-month intervention period were monitored using the FDA MAUDE database and none were reported.
